column4: Ugh, this is unfortunate. I accidentally unchecked Enable Networking, but when I rechecked it my Wi-Fi wouldn't connect. I flipped off and on the manual switch, and now Ubuntu won't detect the interface at all. Now what?

Ugh, this is unfortunate. I accidentally unchecked Enable Networking, but when I rechecked it my Wi-Fi wouldn't connect. I flipped off and on the manual switch, and now Ubuntu won't detect the interface at all. Now what? Can anyone offer a suggestion?
You can try sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart  .. I have the same problem you are talking about, but I lose internet until I reboot :/
That and rebooting didn't help. :/
You aren't by chance on a laptop that has a switch that disables wireless that's been flipped to off..?
It has a swith, but I double-checked, it's on.
If you go to edit connections, and under Wireless tab is your router there?
Yes.
What does ifconfig in terminal show?
Only eth0 and lo. Odd, wlan0 should be there....
Agreed, I think Ubuntu has dumbed your ethernet card?
Is a reinstall in order?
I dont think you should have to do that.. there is probably a way to get it to recognize your wireless again.
Question is ... what?
Lets dig around on Google here...
I can't search, my DS is my only way to the Internet 'till my laptop's back up, and it's running ClIRC at the moment.
What does "lshw -c network" show? Probably no card right?
Actually, it's there ... Says it's disabled.
Oh, ok. so we just have to enable it.
Um, .. so this is kind of a guess, but try "sudo ifconfig wlan0 up"
SIOCSIFFLAGS: Resource temporarily unavailible
